identified-content.classifier: Top/News/Sports/Pro Basketball/National Basketball Association/New York Knicks

block.p: The Knicks are hoping for more production from their designated energizer, Marcus Camby, against Miami. Camby rebounded well, averaging 7.7 a game, but was not much of a factor offensively in the first-round sweep of Toronto.

The Knicks assistant Don Chaney believes the off-the-court controversy surrouding Camby and Raptors Coach Butch Carter affected the forward's play. Carter filed and later dropped a lawsuit against Camby, who had called his former coach a liar.

The Knicks are hoping for more production from their designated energizer, Marcus Camby, against Miami. Camby rebounded well, averaging 7.7 a game, but was not much of a factor offensively in the first-round sweep of Toronto.

The Knicks assistant Don Chaney believes the off-the-court controversy surrouding Camby and Raptors Coach Butch Carter affected the forward's play. Carter filed and later dropped a lawsuit against Camby, who had called his former coach a liar.
''I think he got caught up in all of the things that were going on outside of the game, and you just can't do that,'' Chaney said of Camby.
''It didn't distract me,'' Camby said. ''If anything, it distracted them. Their players were complaining about their coach. It never affected me.''
